comment: Very tough, little to no leniency at all, quick to call you out if you are doing something correctly, takes forever or doesn't respond at all to emails. If I wasn't as good as I was at Solidworks, I would have a hard time because he really does not teach that much, just powerpoint lectures. He calcuated my grade wrong but I got an A so it's okay.

The material itself isn't too difficult but the format of the class makes everything unnecessarily difficult. Generally, there's one homework per unit, and you use that one and ONLY hw to study for 2 different quizzes AND an exam. Very little involvement within D2L, everything and ALL ANNOUNCEMENTS are made in class.

Save yourself the headache and take the ME version and get it overrided. Tests are very difficult, and are often very different then ones gone over in class. Professor doesn't exactly create a wonderful environment to be in. He will pick on you if you give the slightest hint you don't know something.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: This is actually for MET 3126 Engr Dynamics, but that is not listed here. Heavily hands off as he expects you to learn instantly from a textbook. Also very unorganized and lacks passion. This is not a professor, he is simply there to tell you when exams are and what chapters to read over. Does one problem and concludes that is enough. Avoid!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: Currently, I am taking Professor Braswell for Applied Engineering Math. His lectures are very insightful because he is concise and values students' attention/participation. He makes the material being taught surprisingly simple and easy to grasp. I am not sure how he is with his other classes, but he is a great professor in my opinion.

Good luck if you are MET at KSU. Because everyone I talk to hates this guy. He is not willing to work with you, and half the time in lecture he is either complaining about your class or not teaching. Worst part is he is the only one that teaches like 3 or 4 classes. Either take Statics, Dynamics, and ENGT 2000 online, or prepare to teach yourself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment:
I took Braswell for statics and he was hands down the worst teacher I've taken in my 5 years of taking college classes.
Started dynamics with him, realized I wasn't going to learn anything from his terrible teaching style so I withdrew and took it with the ME professor and got an A. 
Avoid if at all possible.

Really, only gives out assignment dates orally and doesn't post the instructions or assignment online until the day of. I did not receive any feedback on most of my assignments until just before the midterm or, for the last half of the semester, right before the final. The final review quiz, w 84 questions was posted two days before the test.GPA L

willing to work with people. But often switches up assignment instructions/guidelines last minute. he has left us with 2 assignments while he is out of town with no access to the lab or way to view/submit the assignments. Which is important because we are physically measuring objects to model. And is not responding to any emails.
